definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: I suggest you (should) ask Mr Wu for advice.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你向吴先生求教。

sentences.english: To explore a range of responsibilities, to seek to colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 责任范围作一探讨，以求教于同仁。

sentences.english: People came from a distance of ten leagues around to consult M. Madeleine.
sentences.chinese: 周围十法里以内的人都来向马德兰先生求教。

sentences.english: Li Zhongming refer to qingcheng mountain early, qingcheng mountain decided to help.
sentences.chinese: 黎仲明向尚青城开始求教，尚青城决定帮忙。

sentences.english: At this moment, consulting Mr. Graham's wisdom is especially fitting.
sentences.chinese: 在这种时候，求教格拉汉姆的智慧显得尤为合适。

sentences.english: People came from far and wide to be taught by Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 人们从远方来向孔子求教。

sentences.english: To seek advice does not lessen the greatness or argue incapacity .
sentences.chinese: 求教于人无损于你的伟大，也不会得你无能。

sentences.english: We often asked the veteran workers for advice.
sentences.chinese: 我们常常向老工人求教。

sentences.english: He ought to look to his sisters for guidance.
sentences.chinese: 他应该向他的姐姐们求教指导意见。

sentences.english: Then two people ask for advice together sexology Great Master.
sentences.chinese: 于是两人一起去求教性学大师。

definition: to come with a specific purpose in mind
not feel ashamed to ask and learn from one's subordinates
to dispel doubts/to clear up confusion
to receive instruction/to benefit from advice
to show sb how to get to the right path
to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
to help/to do a favor/(Shanghainese) Come on!/Give me a break!
to ask for help/to ask a favor/to recruit talented people
